weekly_journal: Biggest challenge of the week is Getting used to with the git workflow. I implemented the authentication token system with JWT and Cookies. And used a php module to hash emails and make it a Universal Avatar (gravatar) and I handled Creating users in a secure way with Bcrypt. Then I hooked up my routes into the front end which I did the login form! So far everything is working out with my part and I helped fix bugs on deployment with the Procfile from heroku
favorite_pr: My favorite PR's are the 7,22,28 because I implemented our cool token system that can speed up and store users data with the use of advanced middleware principles,cookies and jwt token system

weekly_journal: I implemented the login system on a way that it is interfacing with the frontend site and backend site! I left some alert messages when they successfully registered or logged in.I added a lot of new libraries which is Express-sessions, Connect-knex-session, Express-Validator, PassportJS, Passport-Local. And I implemented tests on the backend server.
favorite_pr: My favorite PR was #46 where I tested the backend server's endpoints. I tested the server with Jest and Supertest module from npm. It is my favorite PR because it will help speed up the development process which will help us detect regressions later on as we scale our database.

weekly_journal: I implemented Updating Users Functionality with Resetting Their Password functionality it was pretty fulfilling because the team was at 90% complete due to us working hard and it was nice to know that you contributed some to help the project to reach that point
favorite_pr: My favorite PR is PR#111 because I handled the users reset password which can get a little bit complicated but I didnt have any problem with it so I was happy with the progress that I made in that small amount of time and it was pretty satisfying that the project was easy to scale because it integrated the features in the frontend in no time
